MUSEUM OF BYZANTINE CULTURE OF THESSALONIKI
1. EARLY CHRISTIAN CHURCHES\n 2. EARLY CHRISTIAN CITY AND PRIVATE DWELLING\n 3. FROM THE ELYSIAN FIELDS TO THE CHRISTIAN PARADISE\n 4. FROM ICONOCLASM TO THE SPLENDOUR OF THE MACEDONIAN AND KOMNENIAN DYNASTIES\n 5. THE DYNASTIES OF BYZANTINE EMPERORS\n 6. BYZANTINE CASTLES\n 7. THE TWILIGHT OF BYZANTIUM\n 8-9. DONATED COLLECTIONS\n 10. THE BYZANTINE LEGACY IN THE YEARS AFTER THE FALL OF CONSTANTINOPLE\n 11. DISCOVERING THE PAST\n

Remaining time
HelpScreenActivity
FullscreenActivity
GENERAL \n Through this application you get to know the Museum of Byzantine Culture of Thessaloniki via a funny treasure hunt. \n You should visit every room in the museum, answer the questions and gather all your abilities, in order to solve the riddles you come across.\n Complete your museum tour with the greatest score.\n\n 1. Follow the clues on the screen \n 2. Use the QR code scanner to locate the correct exhibit\n 3. Fulfill successfully all the questions and the riddles, to increase your score.\n Visit this page: http://83.212.117.226/ and create your own museum.
QUIZ GAME\n One question, four possible answers. \n The only thing you have to do is to find the right one.\n How good are you in history?
WHERE ARE THE MONUMENTS?\n Can you find the location of the monument on the map, knowing the monument and the location name?\n Choose the location on the map, as close as possible to the right one, to score more points\n The clues you are asking for are hidden on the museum\'s walls
CATCH ME IF YOU CAN\n The faster your reflexes are the better.\n Hit the moving image in order to complete the bigger picture in the end of the game.\n The more successful hits you manage, the more points you score and you get a cleaner view at on of the museum\'s masterpieces.
SAVE THE ARCHES\n In fact it is all about the classic hangman game.\n All you have to do is to guess the word before all the arches come down.\n What is the words are kind of unusual and Greek, take a good look at your surroundings and the museum will give you the answer
ALL COINS HAVE TWO FACES\n Can you figure out who they are?\n Match them as soon as possible to score points. The more observant you are, the sooner you will finish.\n Remember nothing is over until you move on to the next room of the museum.
FILL IT UP\n Only if you put everything in place you can see what the picture is hidding.\n It is a classical puzzle game, also known as "Fast and neatly"
FIND THE RIGHT ORDER\n Some of the pottery we admire up to this day, took a lot of time in order to look like this and carry all these details.\n Put in the rigth order the production stages, their names and form, as fast as you can to increase your score
FIND THE PAIRS OF THE CLAY VESSELS\n You have a few seconds to observe and memorize the pairs formed by the clay vessels. \n Then you have to use your memory to locate those pairs with the least possible selections on screen.
CATCH THE EXHIBIT, SAVING IT FROM DESTRUCTION\n Random exhibits are falling from the sky. Watch the screen for the exhibit you must catch and save it.\n But beware, don\'t catch the wrong one. In the end you have the chance to see information about the exhibit you are trying to save.
OBSERVE CAREFULLY THE COINS\n Try to remember the order in which they are illuminated.\nThen select them exactly in the same order.
LoadingScreen
HelpDialogActivity
CreditsActivity
The game "Amusing Museum" is an application for educational purposes. It has been developed in order to help the visitor of the Museum of Byzantine Culture of Thessaloniki, to see the museum via a funny treasure hunt.\n The application was developed during the Summer School of Open Source Projects of University of Macedonia and the department of Applied Informatics.\n Developer Team:\n Dimopoulos Theodoros - Christos\n Kotsikoris Panagiotis\n Moschou Athanasia\n\n
Have a nice tour of the Byzantine treasures in our city! !
Find the exhibit ! QR code Code

Locate the Tetraeuangelo (late 11th - early 12th century ) and proceed to the next puzzle by scanning or by entering the code of the monument .
Locate Manuel Komneno\'s hyperpyron and proceeded to the next puzzle by scanning or by entering the code of the monument .
Locate the solidus of Heraklion and proceed to the next puzzle by scanning or by entering the code of the monument .
Locate the ceramic filter or else strainer and proceed to the next puzzle by scanning or by entering the code of the monument .

EARLY CHRISTIAN CHURCHES

PRIVATE DWELLING

SPLENDOUR OF THE MACEDONIAN
AND KOMNENIAN DYNASTIES

BYZANTINE EMPERORS
BYZANTINE CASTLES

THE BYZANTINE LEGACY

FALL OF CONSTANTINOPLE
DISCOVERING THE
PAST
Part of a mural mosaic with fountain which until recently was covered by the most recent western wall of the central aisle of the basilica. In detached mosaic, the lower portion luxurious jets is illustrated, shown in blue color, by which overflows water falling on leaf stalks and a bird. The show is developed into a gold background.
Reliquary. Rectangular casket with flat cover, fastened with hooks. Its four sides adorn reliefs with scenes from the Old and New Testaments. On the front side, it represents the Tradition of the Law by Christ to the apostles Peter and Paul. On the reverse side there are depicted the Three Children in the furnace. On narrow sides there are depicted Daniel in the lion\'s den and the delivery of the Ten Commandments to Moses.
Spherical shape amphora with a conical neck ending in poor glass spout. The two arched handles are formed parallel to the shoulders of the amphora. Subtle horizontal grooves mellowed in the wheel run around the body of the amphora at the height of its shoulder.
The obverse shows a bust of Emperor Justinian, with military clothing and crusader bullet in the right hand. All around we read the inscription DN IVSTINIANVS PPAVG (Dominus Noster Iustinianus Perpetuus Augustus, which means, our Lord, Justinian, the eternal emperor).
Vaulted tomb full of paintings organized in panels with scenes from the Old and New Testament. The eastern narrow side of the tomb is decorated with a table surrounded by red and green band and portrays the protoplasts after their disobedience. The show is organized around tree with lush foliage in the trunk of which there is a wrapped snake.
Bracket monopod, of a luxurious table, made from a piece of marble. It consists of a cubic base with four small rectangular legs in its corners- by means of which rests on the ground. The main view of the brace is adorned with sculpted form on the iconographic type of the "Good Shepherd", the young shepherd with a ram on his shoulders.
Pair of gold pods. Each wristband is covered by 20 tiles defined by granular film, which are decorated with fenced technical enamel, cloisonne. The tiles depict alternately a bird pecking a leaf, a palm and a rosette and are rendered in different color variations.
Tetraeuangelo contains readings which are read on Sunday, Saturday and weekdays in the church. It consists of 325 sheets of parchment and is truncated. The text has two columns, with notation, written in an upright, rounded, elaborate minuscule scripture echoing the style of the second half of the 11th and early 12th century.
In one aspect, which is curved, Christ is depicted in the figure of Emmanuel, so he is young. It is flanked by the inscription IC- XC (Jesus Christ) and around the invocation “+ principal assistant “.In the back side, which is hollow, Manuel is illustrated standing wearing an imperial dress, holding banner and crusader orb.
On one side there is depicted the Emperor Heraclius on the left and his son and also emperor Heraclius Constantine on the right, wearing chlamys and crown with a cross. Among their heads there is a cross. All around there is the inscription ddNNhERACLIUS EthERACONSTPPAV (Dominus Noster Heraclius et Heraclius Constantinus Perpetuus Augustus), which means "our Gentlemen Heraclius and Heraclius Constantine the Eternal Emperors".
Filter, or in other words colander or strainer hemispherical. Incised wavy line runs around the rim. The whole body of the vase is pierced. The holes were opened, of course, while the clay was still damp with a sharp tool and with the direction from the interior of the vessel to the outward. The filter has been serving through the centuries the same use which remained in an unchanged shape until today.
The castles were fortified settlements, obtaining the basic functions of a city. They were built in key positions who controlled the passes of roads and offered protection to the inhabitants and residents of the surrounding region in seasons of war. The limited space and the morphology of the terrain determined the urban organization of the castles and the changes in the architecture of the houses.
TOP 5`
Statistics
Oinochoe from the 4th century AD. Its height is 16.5 cm. αnd diameter 4.5 cm. It is made of pale green glass. The base is flat unformatted. The body is octagonal and decorated with side stripes.\nThe almost cylindrical neck is reduced slightly towards the ring-shaped rim which is horizontal, and folded. The vessel is constructed with the technique of blowing into two successive molds. Lamp dated around the 6th century and is made of copper alloy.\n It has spherical body, disc-shaped base, elongated spout and a hole with clam-shaped cover. The handle is a cross with forked antennae. On the back of the cross, there is a carrying handle attached to support the cross. Clay whistle from the 3rd-4th century with a height of 9.3 cm and base diameter 2.7cm. It was discovered north of the cemetery of Evangelistria, on the eastern Thessaloniki. \n The upper body of the vessel has a cylindrical appendage with a spout and a small hole in the surface for the functioning of the whistle. When the vase was filled with water the sound produced when using the whistle imitated the chirping of a bird. The sound differed depending on the height of the water level in the vessel. The format of this game remained unchanged until today as similar whistles sold as toys so far, especially at festivals remote from urban areas. Wooden portable picture that was created around 1200 AD. It\'s height is 53 cm, width is 28.5 cm and it has thickness of 3 cm. \nThe Virgin is depicted in the middle, praying with her left hand on the chest, holding on the right the young Christ, blessing with corresponding hand while holding a wrapped scroll in his left. The iconographic archetype of the image located in the 6th century work in Rome. Glass unguentarium of the 4th century with a height of 8 cm and base diameter of 3 cm. \n It has flat base and a spherical body with a form of two young people\'s heads and a tall neck widening in ends horizontally creating in that way a ring-shaped lip. It was found in the West Cemetery of Thessaloniki, at Kallithea 5 street. Glass bracelet of the 10th-12th century. It originates from Macedonia but the place of discovery is unknown. \nIt is flat on the inside and curved on the outside. It is decorated by yellow and gold colors. It is separated vertically by triple stripes in six rectangular fields which are alternatively: a bird with a long neck, possibly a swan with its wings stretched and three horizontal zigzags, two gold and a central yellow. Archieratic garment of the 18th century made of silk, linen, gold and silver. \nIn the front side we see meandering vine shoots with grapes, resulting in oval medallions, within which the apostles are depicted. In large central framework we see enthroned Christ Pantocrator and the Feast of the Annunciation. On the back side we see the genealogical tree of Christ, known as the "Root of Jesse" according to the prophecy of Isaiah. Golden coin made between 1164-1167 AD. \nIn one side, which is the curved, Christ is depicted in the formula of Emmanuel, which means at young age. On the other side, which is hollow,there is Manuel I, with imperial dress, holding a banner and a crusader sphere. Leaden seal of emperor Constantine VII Porphyrogenitus (913-959 AD) with a diameter of 3.4 cm and a weight of 19.88 gramms. \nOn the one side we see Christ Pantocrator with the original IC-XC (Jesus Christ).On the orher side there is the Emperor Constantine VII wearing imperial clothes and holding the crusader ball in his right hand.The display of the emperor in the seal is an excellent example of portraiture of the time. Colored copperplate engraved in 1798 by the monk painter Nikiforos descended from Karpenissi. It\'s height is 48.5 cm and it\'s width is 34.5 cm. \nIn the central frame we see St George the dragon-slayer above the monastery of Xenofontos, which is dedicated to the saint. On the upper right, Christ is blessing St George and on the left Saint Marina is praying with a cross in her hand. Marble inlay created with the opus sectile technique in the 7th century. Ir\'s height and width is 80 cm and it was found at the church of St. Demetrius at Thessaloniki. In the central circle we have two red squares and inside the created corners we see white leeves Wall painting of the 5th century discovered at the west wall of a vaulted tomb, depicting the biblical story of Sosannas. \nThe show is divided into two zones, one of which is the lower one which shows a scaly thorakion that ends up taking the shape of a pine tree. On the second zone we have a floor as two wide stripes of green and orange and in from of them we see Sosanna between the two Jewish Judges. Marble embossed plate of the 11th century coming from Thessaloniki.\nIt was used to decorate the long side of a Christian tomb of the 11th-12th century. The left half part is missing. In the main view, within the framework, two crosses are represented in graded foundations. The cross on the right is roman and framed by branched that grow from the base. Over the branches we see an eagle on the right and a smaller bird on the left. The cross left is a Resurrection cross with double horizontal rows and a tree is growing from within. A copy of a mural found in a vaulted tomb at Nigde 6-8 street outside the western walls of Thessaloniki, at the settlement Tyroloe. It was created in 1950 and has a height of 75.5 cm and a width of 171 cm.\n It displays two colorful birds in front of a bown of fruits. The background is decorated with flowers. The scene looks like a heavenly landscape, refering to the afterlife. On the top and bottom of the image we it is decorated by red stripes. A book used in churches to structure chants and hymns of saints of Byzantine music. It was created around the 17th century with a height of 17.5 cm and width 12 cm.
Oinochoe Lamp Clay whistle Wooden picture Glass unguentarium Glass bracelet Archieratic garment Golden coin Leaden seal Colored copperplate Marble inlay Wall painting of a vaulted tomb Marble embossed Colorful mural Byzantine music book We are looking for:
